lines.gurmukhi: bwhr kI Agin bUJq jl srqw kY nwau mY jau Agin lwgY kYsy kY buJweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Baahar Kee Agani Boojhat Jal Sarataa Kai , Naau Mai Jau Agani Laagai Kaisay Kai Bujhaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Fire burning outside the stream can be extinguished with the water of the stream, but if the boat in the river catches fire, how can that be extinguished?

lines.gurmukhi: bwhr sY Bwig Et lIjIAq kot gV gV mY jau lUit lIjY kho kq jweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Baahar Sai Bhaagi Aot Leejeeat Kot Garha , Garh Mai Jau Looti Leejai Kaho Kat Jaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Escaping from the attack of a robber while out in the open, one can run and take shelter in a fort or such other place but when someone robs in the fort, what can be done then?

lines.gurmukhi: corn kY qRws jwie srin ghY nirMd mwrY mhIpiq jIau kYsy kY bcweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Choran Kai Traas Jaai Sarani Gahai Narinda , Maarai Maheepati Jeeu Kaisay Kai Bachaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If for fear of thieves one takes refuge with a ruler and if the ruler starts punishing, then what can be done ?

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw fr frpq hwr gurduArY jwvY qhw jau mwieAw ibAwpY khw ThrweIAY ]544]
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Dar Darapat Haar Gurduarai Jaavai , Tahaa Jau Maaiaa Biaapai Kahaa Tthaharaaeeai ?544?

Shabad OS B.translation: Fearing the dragon-net of worldly compulsions, if one goes to the door of Guru, and if maya overpowers on him there too, then there is no escape. (544)
